title: DPD Intelligence on Purported Gangs Hustle Boys and Knock Out Boys

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: DPD Intelligence on Purported Gangs Hustle Boys and Knock Out Boys
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting information from fourteen years ago regarding DPD records relating to two purported gangs--the "Hustle Boys" and the "Knock Out Boys" that the Detroit Police Department was in possession of in 2010. This request includes all "List DPD Narrative" reports containing these two search terms, as well as the underlying reports from those events contained in that search. For instance, we know the search term "Hustle Boys" appears in a 6/18/2009 homicide narrative bearing CRISNET number 0906180015.6 (Supplement 6). We would like the full list of searches, as well as the underlying reports. We are also requesting any Detroit Police Intelligence Data information, to include photos and lists of suspected members of the "Hustle Boys" and "Knock Out Boys" and any information justifying inclusion of those individual in the organizational chart. For instance, we are aware of a chart containing the names Delmerey Morris and Deonta Morris photos that appears to be a roster of people the Detroit Police believed to be in "Hustle Boys." We are asking for any other versions of that chart and all charts relating to the "Knock Out Boys" 

We are requesting any information regarding the gang affiliations of Tyree Washington, JB Watson, Elmer Allwood, and William Beal, if not included in the materials requested above. 

We request any intelligence reports or information regarding the date of formation, the gangs' goals, any list of crimes perpetrated by members of, or in furtherance of, the gangs' enterprise, or other information pertaining to these two purported gangs.

If any information is not available or has been purged, we request the date of the information purge and other information regarding the identity or the entity purging these documents, or the order to purge this information.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Blase Schmid

title: Murder Investigation Case File Athony, Delores, Marc and Shelby Harris, Killed in 1989

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Murder Investigation Case File Athony, Delores, Marc and Shelby Harris, Killed in 1989
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to submit a Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to obtain documents related to the murder investigation of Tony and Delores Harris, 15-year-old Shelby, and 11-year-old Marc, which occurred on December 22, 1989, in Danby, NY. The murder investigation was conducted jointly by the New York State Police and the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI).

I kindly request the disclosure of the following information and records, including but not limited to:

Autopsy reports for Tony and Delores Harris, Shelby, and Marc.
Investigation records, including case files, incident reports, and evidence logs.
Audio recordings related to the investigation, such as 911 calls, police radio transmissions, and interviews.
Emails exchanged between investigators, law enforcement agencies, and relevant parties during the course of the investigation.
Phone logs and transcripts pertaining to communication between individuals involved in the case.
Interview records, including transcripts, summaries, and notes from interviews conducted with witnesses, suspects, and persons of interest.
DNA reports and analysis results related to the crime scene and evidence collected.
Letters, correspondences, and written communications associated with the investigation.
Photographs, both digital and hard copies, depicting the crime scene, victims, suspects, and evidence.
Notes, memoranda, and internal communications related to the investigation, including inter-agency communications.
Furthermore, I request that the scope of this FOIA request includes any information and records specifically related to the main suspect, Michael Anthony Kinge, also known as Anthony Turner, born on September 10, 1956, and deceased on February 7, 1990

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jolynn Rice

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jolynn Rice

title: Murder Investigation of Tony,Delores, Shelby, and Marc Harris in 1989

The murder investigation was conducted jointly by the New York State Police and the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI).

I kindly request the disclosure of the following information and records, including but not limited to:

Autopsy reports for Tony and Delores Harris, Shelby, and Marc.
Investigation records, including case files, incident reports, and evidence logs.
Audio recordings related to the investigation, such as 911 calls, police radio transmissions, and interviews.
Emails exchanged between investigators, law enforcement agencies, and relevant parties during the course of the investigation.
Phone logs and transcripts pertaining to communication between individuals involved in the case.
Interview records, including transcripts, summaries, and notes from interviews conducted with witnesses, suspects, and persons of interest.
DNA reports and analysis results related to the crime scene and evidence collected.
Letters, correspondences, and written communications associated with the investigation.
Photographs, both digital and hard copies, depicting the crime scene, victims, suspects, and evidence.
Notes, memoranda, and internal communications related to the investigation, including inter-agency communications.
Furthermore, I request that the scope of this FOIA request includes any information and records specifically related to the main suspect, Michael Anthony Kinge, also known as Anthony Turner, born on September 10, 1956, and deceased on February 7, 1990

 


The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jolynn Rice

title: Body-cam, Dash-cam and training certification for officer Kellen Hood #110 for incident # HP24000783CR

communications.subject: South Dakota Open Records Law Request: Body-cam, Dash-cam and training certification for officer Kellen Hood #110 for incident # HP24000783CR
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Dakota Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Officer camera recordings, such as arresting officers body-cam and dash-cam related to incident #HP24000783CR that took place at or near mile marker 15 on interstate 90 at or about 5:46 pm on the date of 02/16/2024 resulting in the arrest of Kristin Bercier. 
  I would also like to request a record of any and all training completion certifications for officer Kellen Hood badge #110, particularly training completion for DUI marijuana field test.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Steven Tyler Torgerson

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Flock Safety Permitting Issues
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A recent article published by Forbes (https://www.forbes.com/sites/thomasbrewster/2024/02/27/flock-safety-surveillance-broke-state-law/) states that "[Flock Safety has] run afoul of regulators in Texas and Washington over permitting issues".

Please provide all memos, documents, and email communications regarding permitting issues involving Flock Safety devices, including any attachments and associated metadata.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

title: Public Records Request: Vacancies, Classroom Associates, and Substitute Teachers

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Public Records Request: Vacancies, Classroom Associates, and Substitute Teachers
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide the following data for the 2023-2024 academic year:

- Number of vacancies by school 
- Number of positions closed since the start of the year by school 
- Number of classroom associate positions assigned to each school
- Number of filled classroom associate positions at each school
- Number of sub jobs created by school since start of year
- Number of filled sub jobs by school since start of year 

Please provide responsive records as an excel or csv file.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with e.

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Public Records Request: Teacher Data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Documents sufficient to show the number of suspensions, dismissals, resignations, and non-renewals of certified employees by building in Metro Nashville Public Schools. The requested data is to be based on the academic years of 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, and 2022-2023.

Please provide responsive records in an excel or csv file.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with e.

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Public Records Request: TEAMs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Metadata for email communications sent or received, including being CCed or BBCed, which include at least one of the email addresses listed below between the dates of 1/1/2022 and 2/15/2024 including one at least of the following keywords: "TEAMs” or "Evaluation." Please include any variations that are not case sensitive. 

- Carl Carter
- Priscilla Cole
- Celia Conley
- Felicia Everson-Tuggle
- Natalyn Gibbs
- Craig Hammond
- Chad High
- David Kovach
- Shawn Lawrence
- Damaris Luna
- Chaerea Snorten 
- Schunn Turner
- Justin Uppinghouse 
- Kristopher Winfrey 

The specific metadata data points I'm interested in are: to address(es), from address, cc address(es), bcc address(es), sent date/time, received date/time, subject line, and if the email has an attachment. This request does not seek the contents of the emails themselves, and only the specified email metadata. Please provide me with the records in an Excel format.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with e.

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with e.

- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

Miriam Bhimani

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: UC Berkeley
communications.communication:
Hello,

The UC Office of the President (UCOP) has received your Public Records Act request, below. UCOP does not have these campus records; you would need to submit a request directly to the campus using the contact information here:
https://www.ucop.edu/uc-legal/legal-resources/information-practices/information-practices-coordinators.html

We consider this request closed.

Sincerely,
UCOP Public Records
UC, Office of the President
1111 Franklin St.
Oakland, CA 94607
pra@ucop.edu

title: Subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Watchlist Inquiry (Department of Homeland Security)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Department of Homeland Security,

I, LaJuana A. Reid, am writing to request information under the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552). Specifically, I seek records, documents, and any other information pertaining to myself, LaJuana A. Reid, especially related to watchlisting. My watchlist identification number, as understood, is 9596690-00.

I request a search of all relevant databases and systems maintained by your department, including any lists, indices, or databases related to national security, immigration, and customs enforcement watchlists.

Please include any guidance, policies, or procedures related to the nomination, maintenance, or removal of individuals from such lists, as well as any records regarding my specific inclusion or consideration for inclusion.

If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform me if the cost will exceed $50. However, I would like to request a waiver of all fees for this request. Disclosure of this information is in the public interest because it contributes significantly to the understanding of government operations and activities, specifically the criteria and processes for watchlisting individuals.

I look forward to your prompt response within the statutory 20 business day period.

Sincerely,

LaJuana A. Reid

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

LaJuana A. Reid

title: Oklahoma City bombing sketches and wanted posters

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Oklahoma City bombing sketches and wanted posters
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all high resolution copies of composite sketches made of any individual(s) suspected in the Oklahoma City bombing on April 19, 1995, including, but not limited to, Timothy James McVeigh and John Doe 2. Also requested are any wanted posters or graphics created for the public or police agencies displaying information on the wanted suspects. A format such as a PDF is preferred, and if not, a high quality PNG, are requested for any responsive documents to this request. Should neither of these be available, any other format that can be accessed and viewed by a common personal computer would be accepted.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Gerardo Bravo

title: Copy Of My Case File With All Supporting Documents

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Copy Of My Case File With All Supporting Documents
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello - I am requesting a copy of my case file which was submitted via IC3 more than ten years ago. I am 68 years old and I am unemployed an in a dire economic situation. I lost $80,000.00 via a cyber crime given my vulnerabilities. I immediately reported this scam to the FBI via their IC3 website. I never had the courtesy of a single response from the FBI since I filed that case of online theft. Not a single response. It's fairly obvious to me that absolutely nothing was investigated. I now suffer from memory loss and cardio vascular disease. I have identified a private company which is willing to investigate this scam on my behalf. I am not optimistic that I will recover any funds given the elapsed timeframe. However, I need to try. I really thought the FBI will act given the amount of money I lost.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Earl James Gobin
